review_title: Purposeful work, amazing colleagues, toxic workplace
pros: Inspiring work with global reach. Meaningful projects designed to improve people's lives. Intellectual challenges. Exposure to sector experts and influencers.
cons: Not very flexible. Top leadership disconnected from its staff. Unkind, condescending and malicious. Conservative mentality. Lots of unpaid and unrewarded overtime. Nepotism.
The salary being paid is a lot less than the market
- Low salary - Poor management - Limited up mobility

pros: Good pay and great benefits. Lots and lots of funding from the government. Many very talented and smart colleagues, but unfortunately for the large part their talent is not getting put to use due to the inefficient structure and micromanagement.
cons: Uninspiring CEO who built an atmosphere of secrecy, fear and blind following among senior management. All about the 'we are all in this together' talk, but 'stab you in the back' in practice. Changes take forever, and the org is very much top-down, where the senior management make almost all of the decisions. No feedback culture. Working there is mostly uninspiring and quite draining.
